TopicTitle: Inline advanced Stabilzer and the Inline Reaction Wheel

Articles.Content: Whats with those two part? They only look different. They both provide the same amount of torque. Is the Stabilizer just a useless part? Or does it have some advantages statistically?

The parts used to be very different, but now serve the same purpose, and unfortunately the same stats aside from mass.

Ideally the stabilizer would be more potent, and the reaction wheel would not have SAS.

Squad devs need some friendly prodding to rebalance those parts

The advanced stabilizer USED to provide SAS functionality to ships. This functionality is now provided by command pods. My understanding is that they simply left the part in the game for backwards compatibility so people's persistence files wouldn't get corrupted because that part didn't exist anymore...
More chat about these parts is in: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69428-Spin-Stabilization-Question. TL;DR - use the IRW as it masses less.
